attributes.action: Reopen the Hambleton Village Railway Station
attributes.background: I'd like to propose the reopening of Hambleton Village Station (closed in 1959) due to massive population expansion with the nearest alternative stations being Selby and South Milford. These trains pass the old station platform anyway and could easily stop to collect!
attributes.additional_details: The original station was located at the end of Station Road, Hambleton YO8

attributes.action: Put tuition fees back to £3000 per year
attributes.background: The cost of university tuition is ridiculous. Along with the scrapping of the maintenance grant, students can expect to be saddled with up to £50000 debt. £3000 per year can ensure that universities maintain high standards whilst students don't have to break the bank (as much).
attributes.additional_details: The government claims that this is no problem as there are loans, yet it is obvious with this year's decreasing number of people going to university that no one sees the benefit. Students can no longer afford a fun night out: they must work to top up their maintenance loan, and although the standard of tuition may have risen due to concern on whether it is value for money, the cost is putting the most disadvantaged off going as they can't face having all the debt.

attributes.action: Give PCV licence holders category C1 licence aswell.
attributes.background: PCV holders or category D licence holders are able to drive any size bus e.g double deckers and bendy buses which can weigh in excess of 18 tonnes but cannot drive a vehicle which weighs less than half of this.
attributes.additional_details: Driving people around in a bus or coach is much more difficult than driving a small lorry half the size of the vehicles I can drive which weighs up to 7.5 tonnes. Even to drive certain vans which can weigh 4.2 tonnes cannot be done if classed as a normal van but if classed as a minibus it can be driven but the size is no different and neither are the tachograph laws.

attributes.action: Repeal the Resale Prices Act to reflect & protect high street retailing in 2017
attributes.background: The simplistic view of the 1964 RRP Act does not consider the damage caused by 'pop up' internet retailers & is clearly not in the long term public interest (requirement of the Act). The CMA enforcement of this ruling is forcing retailers to close, removing our conduit to consumer education & jobs!
attributes.additional_details:
"The UK supply chain supports 1,700 companies across a diverse lighting sector and is worth £2.3bn to the economy. The UK is home to more than 140 lighting design practices that specify lighting for mainly overseas projects and which present a unique opportunity for lighting manufacturers to access global markets.” Michael Fallon MP.

Jobs are being lost across the sector, training has almost ceased because retailers cannot make a living; this ACT must be urgently reviewed to save the industry.

attributes.action: Change the Postal Voting rules to prevent voter fraud
attributes.background: At the moment anyone can apply for a postal vote. The Government should change the way postal votes are allowed. Only people who are seriously ill or out of the country on holiday or business should be allowed to have them.
attributes.additional_details: Postal Votes are open to widespread abuse. The Government should change the rules to prevent systemic postal vote abuse.

attributes.action: UK citizens should have the right to carry guns for self-defense
attributes.background: Given the current state of affairs in this country, people should be able to defend themselves and their families from terrorist and other criminal entities
attributes.additional_details: Enough is enough the terrorist has weapons why should people in this country live in the fear of being murdered in our own towns. If we are to be expected to live alongside people that want to kill us we should have the right to defend ourselves. Obviously, some kind of background checking system must be put in place if this is to work

attributes.action: Support Kurdistan independence from Iraq
attributes.background: Oppose any and all threats, use of force, blockades, restrictions of movement and other attempts to intimidate the Kurds into submission to tyranny.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Unequivocally support the Kurdish people in Iraq.
2. Oppose any and all threats, use of force, blockades, restrictions of movement and other attempts to intimidate the Kurds into submission to tyranny.
3. Provide every encouragement and assistance for the peaceful establishment of an independent, sovereign and free Kurdish state.

attributes.action: Rescind Donald Trump's state visit invitation.
attributes.background: After Donald Trump was invited to make a state visit to the UK he used a terrorist attack in London to make political capital and to undermine the Mayor of London's response to that attack. The UK government should make its displeasure clear by rescinding his state visit invitation.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been other examples of Donald Trump's actions since the invitation was issued that show he does not deserve this honour:

- He said that there were "many fine people" participating in a neo-nazi / white supremacist rally.
- He equated the actions of those at the rally with the people protesting it.
- He declared transgender people unfit to serve in armed forces in any capacity.

The UK government should demonstrate a break from these values by rescinding the state visit invitation.

attributes.action: Let mothers be named on marriage certificates
attributes.background:
Currently marriage certificates only allow the fathers name on them and not mothers.

This petition aims to bring the marriage certificate into the 21st century.

attributes.action: Law change to waive impound and storage fees of stolen recovered vehicles.
attributes.background: Why are victims of theft paying for return of their stolen vehicles? It's legalised robbery.

attributes.action: Make it law that airlines allow special assistance car seats on planes
attributes.background: Currently cabin crew have the discretionary power to reject a car seat, and therefore a disabled child their holiday or important trip. Children over the age of 2 may still need a car seat. Intellectual or physical disability can make a standard lap belt unsafe for travel. Make travel inclusive.
attributes.additional_details:
On a recent trip with my 5 year old son we were allowed to take our car seat right up to the plane steps. We were then told the seat and therefore my son were not allowed on the plane by the luggage loaders. When questioned it was explained and confirmed that it was at the discretion of the cabin crew.

Having booked time off, travelled to the airport, had special assistance how is it not law that disabled children be allowed on board with whichever equipment they need to make travel accessible

attributes.action: Scrap the tampon tax. Reduce the price of all sanitary products.
attributes.background: Women spend on average £13 a month on sanitary products. Some women have to chose between food and sanitary products. Women don't make the choice to have a period. It is not a luxury but the government classes it as one.
attributes.additional_details: There is  5% tax on sanitary products. Condoms are given out for free whereas there is a tax on sanitary products.  You can choose to abstain from sex but you can't help having a period.

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Offer Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe diplomatic protection and secure her release.
attributes.background: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe has been imprisoned unjustly in Iran and her case has been set back by Michael Gove and Boris Johnson’s failure to be clear about her motive for travel. She should be offered diplomatic protection and brought back to the UK, with her child Gabriella, as quickly as possible.

attributes.action: Commission an urgent evaluation of the NHS 111 service.
attributes.background:
Research strongly suggests that:
1) Non-clinicians using computer software to manage calls to NHS111 may compromise patient safety.
2) Computer software used by NHS111 may lead to too many people being referred across to the 999 service with a consequent ambulance call out and attendance at A&E.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS England plan an ‘Integrated Urgent Care Clinical Assessment Service’ by March 2019. Without in-depth evaluation of NHS 111 the new service will offer little improvement to patients.

We want the Government to commission an independent body to evaluate NHS111 including analysis of calls and decision support software. Evidence and methods for such an evaluation are here:
http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0277953614008107 http://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/3/11/e003451.short

attributes.action: Ban unsustainable Palm Oil from being used in produce that is sold in the UK.
attributes.background: The Palm Oil industry is linked to major issues such as deforestation, habitat degradation, climate change, animal cruelty and indigenous rights abuses in the countries where it is produced, as the land and forests must be cleared for the development of the oil palm plantations.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.saynotopalmoil.com/Whats_the_issue.php

https://www.rainforest-rescue.org/topics/palm-oil

attributes.action: Cancel plans to make banks check the immigration status of account holders
attributes.background: Starting in January 2018, UK banks will be required to carry out quarterly immigration checks on all account holders. Those found to be resident without permission will have their accounts frozen or closed down. This ramping up of the 'hostile environment' strategy will have disastrous consequences.
attributes.additional_details: Under the immigration act 2014, status checks are required for anyone opening a new bank account in the UK. A 2016 report by the chief inspector of borders and immigration uncovered a 10% error rate. The Home Office simply does not have the administrative capacity or competence to execute checks on 70m accounts without causing huge collateral damage. More fundamentally, attempts to decrease net migration by denying irregular migrants access to necessities are draconian and inhumane.

attributes.action: Allow Term Time Holiday Requests during last week of Summer Term.
attributes.background: The law currently stands that students are not to be taken out of school during term time.  Why is it allowable for schools themselves to do this during the last week of the summer term for trips to Disneyland but not for parents? This is a double-standard.
attributes.additional_details:
A trip to Roman ruins in Paphos, the soon to be lost islands of the Maldives or Red Square in Moscow would be far more educational than a trip to Disneyland. However requests by parents to take children on holiday during the last week of the summer term are routinely denied yet schools offer our children non-educational elitist "trips".

The law needs to be changed to allow essential family time for holidays outside of the defined school holiday period. An open debate for a solution is needed.

attributes.action: Allow same sex couples to both be on a birth certificate without being married
attributes.background: My partner and I are in a same-sex relationship and we wanted to have a baby. We couldn't afford private IVF and didn't want to use the NHS money when we could do it ourselves at home using a sperm donor. Baby born, now my partner isn't allowed on birth certificate because we weren't married.
attributes.additional_details: Because we didn't use a private clinic or the NHS and we weren't married at the time of conception my partner is unable to go on the birth certificate. She is now having to adopt our baby to get step parent rights instead of full parental rights, which is emotionally costly as well as financially. It now leaves our daughter's future uncertain should anything happen to me. In this day and age a birth certificate should state name of parents instead of gender specification.

attributes.action: To install defibrillator into all workplaces with 5 or more employees.
attributes.background:
I train first aid courses as my job and when I tell people that there is no definitive law about defibrillators in the workplace all I get is "why not? they would save more lives".

Within the UK sudden cardiac arrest (SCA) is one of the leading causes of premature death.
attributes.additional_details:
Electrical defibrillation is well established as an effective treatment for sudden cardiac arrest, and, if defibrillation is delivered within 3-5 minutes, survival rates can be as high as 50-70%.

The H&S (first aid) Regs 1981 states:
First aid provision must be ‘adequate and appropriate in the circumstances’. 

This to some employers is just a first aider and a first aid kit and I feel this is not enough, so I want to do more into making sure someone has the best chance of survival in an emergency.

attributes.action: Protect Hospitals with exclusion zones preventing protest outside
attributes.background:
Over the past few years a number of groups have set up protests and vigils outside of hospitals. 

We believe this is unacceptable, and that people should be able to access healthcare free from harassment.

The obvious exception being union organised protest for staff.
attributes.additional_details:
We respect the right to free speech, and the right to protest. However, these rights are not without exception, and they cannot be used in a manner which causes harm. 

Individuals also have the right to go about their lawful business free from harassment, and protests and vigils outside the hospital infringe upon this. 

Protests and vigils can be held in a number of places throughout the country, but hospitals are a place for healing. They are accessed by people in their most vulnerable state.

attributes.action: Make recycling of all household low-grade plastics mandatory throughout the UK.
attributes.background: Household non-bottle low-grade plastics, including plastic pots, tubs and trays, are collected for recycling at the roadside in very few UK areas. It therefore goes to landfill. I call on the Government to introduce legislation ultimately leading to the mandatory recycling of all low-grade plastic.
attributes.additional_details: Global plastic use is out of control. We need urgently to reduce plastic waste and mitigate its devastating impact on the environment. A good place to start, and to set an example, is ensuring all household plastic is recycled in the UK. Recycling of plastic pots, tubs and trays (except for black plastic) was successfully introduced by Cornwall Council recently. In other UK areas, this plastic ends up in the general waste bin for landfill. We need to recycle all household plastic across the UK.

attributes.action: Require all schools to have sprinklers fitted.
attributes.background: There are over 700 fires in schools per year but still they do not have sprinklers. Do we need a national tragedy before something happens?

attributes.action: Ban cigarette smoking in public areas.
attributes.background: Most people will agree that inhaling the poison in cigarettes should be optional. Yet we still have to breathe it in when simply walking in public. If you don't want to breathe in the health damaging smoke of passers by then sign this petition to get a government ban on smoking in public spaces.
attributes.additional_details: Smoking and passive smoking has serious health risks. We should all be allowed to choose whether we want to be subjected to those risks.

attributes.action: Ban the cruel Glue traps in which Songbirds Kittens & Hedgehogs starve to death.
attributes.background: Glue traps don't just trap rats and mice, they indiscriminately catch any creature which has the misfortune to come into contact with them sentencing them to a lingering death in agony, until they die from starvation. The makers recommend disposing of the live, trapped victim in household waste.
attributes.additional_details:
Glue Traps are already banned Ireland and New Zealand.
Humane Society International have disturbing videos of all kinds of stuck creatures, trying to free themselves from glue traps which cause "hideous and even illegal cruelty” traps which 68 per cent of the British public would support banning. This can be seen at www.hsi.org
 
PETA, People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals, have fought these since they first went on sale. See www.peta.org/issues/wildlife/wildlife-factsheets/glue-traps

attributes.action: The government should not be transferring all EU Regulations into British law.
attributes.background:
All EU law is bad law.  We do not want one single word of it in British law. The government is transferring 170,000 pages of EU Regulations and Directives into English law. 
It is all just EU Red Tape and it is strangling British industry. 
Say no to the Acquis Communautaire.

attributes.action: Make targeted adverts in public spaces illegal.
attributes.background: The advertising billboards in Piccadilly Circus, for the first time ever, will show different adverts depending on what car you drive and how you look, by scrutinising you using cameras hidden in the screen.  This corporate assault on consensus reality has no place in our democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
References:

(1) https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg23631483-400-giant-screen-in-piccadilly-circus-to-show-targeted-ads-based-on-cars/

(2)http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-4988764/New-screen-London-s-Piccadilly-Circus-track-people.html

(3)https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/personalised-ads-delivered-by-the-billboard-that-s-got-its-eye-on-you-hrxwrrb3z

(4) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telescreen

attributes.action: Re-nationalise the train service
attributes.background: Due to the privatisation of the train services, commuters have experienced frequent delays, with poorer service than would be expected of any EU country's services. On top of this, commuters face high fares, which are rising much faster than the rate of inflation.
attributes.additional_details: If we take Berlin and London, we can see a stark contrast in travel card prices there. For example, a day travel card in Berlin (zones ABC - which includes the city and its surrounding area) would cost an adult 7,70€ (£6.78), however, in London a day travel card (in zones 1-6) would cost an adult £11.70. The difference shows that a nationalised system is cheaper.

attributes.action: Compulsory labelling of recyclability on all products
attributes.background: Many products don't explicitly state whether or not they are recyclable. This creates a lot of confusion and results in recyclable items being put in normal waste bins, which is detrimental to the environment. If non-recyclable items are wrongly disposed of, they can disrupt the recycling process.

attributes.action: A referendum on the ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
attributes.background:
There are continuous debates on the use of the Foreign Aid Budget, from many different sides. Lets have the people that earn / provide the money decide how it should be used, if we are to have one at all.
I suggest four choices: (5th if we use remaining monies for Elderly Care)
attributes.additional_details:
1.	Change nothing maintain the 0.7% of GDP on overseas aid
2.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government on using the 0.7% of GDP for anything else & all remaining monies to be ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
3.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government using the 0.7% of GDP all remaining monies to be spent on replacing the EU subsidies, based upon % share of monies provided by the EU
4. No Foreign Aid Budget

attributes.action: Make it illegal to publish pro-anorexia material online
attributes.background: Anorexia as well as bulimia and other eating disorders are killers. Pro-eating-disorder websites promote bad and dangerous habits –some of which have resulted in serious hospital treatment for me. Anyone can read these websites and be influenced!
attributes.additional_details: jodie_eats_to_live is my recovery account. We need accounts that are honest, and that show recovery and allow people to witness sufferers become so happy and positive! We need positivity and encouragement!

attributes.action: Outlaw and enforce the sale of V5 and V5C vehicle registration documents.
attributes.background:
The V5C registration document is the property of the DVLA and by law needs to be surrendered when a vehicle is disposed of. 
Sadly there is a black market of traders selling V5's and V5C's with or without VIN plates facilitating the change of a vehicle identity. Ringing kits for stolen vehicles.
attributes.additional_details:
By selling a vehicle identity knowingly or not (remember ignorance is no defense) they could well be aiding and abetting the theft of a motor vehicle and should face the same penalties as anyone who is an associate before or after the fact. 

Banning the sale of V5, V5C, VIN plates and other documentation; and enforcing the existing laws more diligently it would effectively cut off the tide of illegal vehicle identity sales thus helping reduce the number of vehicle thefts in the UK.

attributes.action: Ban the use and selling of all aversive dog training equipment in the UK.
attributes.background:
Ban the use and selling of all aversive dog training equipment in the UK 

Prong collars / Pinch collar
Choke Collars
Shock collars / E Collars
Electric dog fence and door mats
attributes.additional_details:
In modern world science has given us the tools we need to train mans best friend without pain and fear. Using outdated training collars that causing pain and fear needs stopping.

It is now your turn to be your dogs best friend and put a stop to all aversive dog training equipment.

attributes.action: Refuse RSPCA entering homes/property to seize animals without permission/police.
attributes.background:
The RSPCA is seeking new powers in England and Wales to search some private property, including sheds and gardens, without a police warrant.
It also wants inspectors who have been invited to enter a home to be able to "seize animals in distress" without awaiting a police presence.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-40542246

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/rspca-government-powers-private-property-remove-pets-defra-england-wales-a7830176.html

attributes.action: Make homework voluntary for children
attributes.background: Homework should be voluntary as children with a high homework load often suffer from mental health problems such as anxiety and depression. The homework given to a child should be limited and not compulsory to allow time to relax, enjoy physical activities and to sleep.

attributes.action: Stop convicted  paedophiles from using the Internet for 5-10-Years
attributes.background:
Laws need to change when it comes to paedophilia.
Banning the Internet for these offenders restricts re offending.

attributes.action: Restore Capital Punishment for terror offences.
attributes.background: With the increase in terrorist attacks and the threat of terrorism our country faces, it is time for the Government to restore Capital Punishment for those convicted of terror offences. Especially those who go on to cause injury or murder British citizens.

attributes.action: Make self defence classes compulsory in schools.
attributes.background: With the rising rates of brutal and savage knife crimes, muggings and terror attacks in the UK, it is vital we begin educating the new generation on how to protect and defend themselves in panic situations.
attributes.additional_details:
An average of 65 people die from knife crime in the UK every year.
Pepper spray is banned in the UK, as are other self defence weapons. 
2017 has seen the biggest rise in terror attacks.

attributes.action: Introduce a 10p disposable cup tax in the UK
attributes.background: Based on the success of the single use plastic bag tax of October 2015, a single use cup tax would help encourage more people to switch to reusable coffee cups, further reducing the UK's plastic waste output.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove, Twitter, 6:37pm 20/11/17:
"Still haunted by last night's #BluePlanet2 - the imperative to do more to tackle plastic in our oceans is clear. We @DefraGovUK will work urgently to identify further action."

Many coffee shops like Costa and Starbucks offer customers the option to provide their own cup, usually encouraged by a small discount. This incentive, combined with the extra cost of a cup tax, should encourage many people to make a small sustainable change.

attributes.action: Make environmental studies a mandatory subject in the National Curriculum
attributes.background: There is currently a lack of knowledge about the detrimental impacts that human activity has on the environment. If a mandatory environmental studies subject is placed in the national curriculum, then this may encourage future generations to act in a more environmentally-friendly manner.
attributes.additional_details: Topics could include – climate change, how much plastic is in the ocean, the impacts of litter on wildlife and the environment, how to live more sustainably/eco-friendly etc. Practicals could include litter picking, tree planting, and outdoor eco-volunteering sessions.

attributes.action: Close the 6 US military bases in the UK.
attributes.background: Magna Carta guarantees the removal of foreign forces following the restoration of peace. In 1942, after Japan attacked Hawaii, American forces established bases in the UK to fight Nazi Germany. In 1945 Adolf Hitler killed himself. On 8 October 2017 American forces still occupied 6 bases in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Magna Carta Clause (51) As soon as peace is restored, we will remove from the kingdom all the foreign knights, bowmen, their attendants, and the mercenaries that have come to it, to its harm, with horses and arms. https://militarybases.com/united-kingdom/ https://www.bl.uk/magna-carta/articles/magna-carta-english-translation

attributes.action: Asthmatics should get free inhalers
attributes.background: Asthma is a condition that affects millions across the UK. Many asthmatics are admitted to hospital each year due to asthma. Asthmatics are forced to spend a large sum of money each month on medication.  If diabetics can get insulin for free then why can't asthmatics get free inhalers?

attributes.action: Make battery farming of livestock illegal and only allow free range farming
attributes.background: There are hundreds of battery farms in the UK that force animals such as Chickens to live in cramped, inhumane conditions where they can barely move. This causes a huge amount of suffering to animals who are not allowed to live in their natural environment.

attributes.action: Deliver on the promise of parity of esteem between mental & physical health.
attributes.background:
With the creation of the Health and Social Bill in 2012, the Conservative government included a demand for parity of esteem, meaning mental and physical health services should be treated equally. 
The government has since failed to deliver on its pledge and it is time for them to take action.
attributes.additional_details:
Having suffered with mental illness myself over the years, I have seen first hand the woeful inadequacy of the current system. Access to care for mental health falls way below physical health. According to the World Health Organisation,depression is now the leading cause of ill health and disability in the world, and by 2030 it will also be the biggest killer.
The government can no longer ignore the mounting evidence about the severity of mental illness, please sign and let's make a difference.

attributes.action: Legislate to vaccinate all cows against TB and stop culling Badgers.
attributes.background: The Government is proposing to allow further Badger culls in an attempt to eradicate TB in cows. It is cruel and doesn't work as previous trials have shown. The should legislate to immunise cows by vaccinating them against TB instead and stop proposing to kill Badgers

attributes.action: Introduce Voluntary Coalition (Normalised Politics) to Northern Ireland.
attributes.background: The current political setup (Mandatory Coalition) is a system of government unfit for purpose. Politics here in Northern Ireland shifts from crisis to crisis, from deadlock to deadlock and has collapsed on more than one occasion.  It's time to normalise politics in NI (Introduce voluntary coalition)
attributes.additional_details:
We the people of Northern Ireland call upon James Brokenshire and Westminster to Introduce a normal political structure (voluntary coalition) in Northern Ireland, like in England, Scotland and Wales even the ROI. 

The most current political crisis should be the last straw.  The current political system (Mandatory Coalition) is having a total negative on the lives of everyone, regardless of community or religion.  

We should no longer be forced to endure a 2nd class system of government in NI.

attributes.action: The Government to pressure the Indian Government to release Jagtar Singh Johal
attributes.background: Jagtar Singh Johal from Dumbarton, West Dunbartonshire, had a sack thrown over his head and was forced into a van by plain-clothes officers on 4 November. The Police in Punjab secretly presented Jagtar Singh Johal before the duty magistrate without informing his family or legal counsel.
attributes.additional_details: Mr Johal, was in India since 2 October for his wedding. He was arrested by Punjab police on November 04 and was presented before a duty magistrate by the police on 05 November. The court had sent him on police remand until 10 November. His remand extension was secretly submitted to the magistrate court so that neither his family or legal counsel could plea against the extension before the magistrate. The lack of information being provided by the authorities is alarming. #freejagginow

attributes.action: Parliament to debate meaning and functioning of democracy in Britain
attributes.background: The government’s reply to a petition calling for a referendum on any deal with the European Union misunderstands democracy, a process whereby nothing is set it stone. We want to hear, on behalf of the British people, what parliament thinks democracy is in Britain, and how it will uphold it.
attributes.additional_details: The reply says that there can be no attempt to reverse the result of a narrowly won, advisory referendum, as it is the will of the people.Yet the will of the people last June overturned a 2015 election and did not deliver a government majority. The petition was not calling for a second referendum on leaving the EU (which would be a third after 1975 and 2016) but a first referendum on the exit deal (it seems pointless to call for a debate on the DeXEUs reading and comprehension skills).

attributes.action: Require internet providers to deny services to anyone convicted of sex offenses
attributes.background: All internet providers should have a database of all people who are on the sex offenders register, and if they are on the register should be declined by ALL PROVIDERS. Just like running a credit check!
attributes.additional_details: I’ve been directly affected by a predator and I want to make a stand, not just for me but for others I know who have also been affected. Downloading indecent pictures of children is a real problem. People forget the children on these images are also victims somewhere down this disgusting line. Something needs to change and these predators need stopping! Please help me make a change and sign this petition!!! Thank you.

attributes.action: Allow recovery agents to have a different colour beacons while working
attributes.background: I believe recovery operatives should be allowed to have a different colour beacon on their vehicles and also be allowed to use flashing red/white lights on the rear of vehicle
attributes.additional_details: Due to there being no restrictions on who can use Orange beacons people no longer take notice of them, we are in effect an emergency service working in one of the most dangerous locations. We should be respected and allowed the same safety of any emergency service who works in a high risk location.
